repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Second Land Administration
            and Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Land
            Administration and Management (LAM) Project for Philippines
            were as follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the
            risk to development outcome was substantial, the Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: for the potential benefits of land title
            and valuation to accrue, other complementary interventions
            ranging from agricultural support to tax administration also
            need to be pursued. The change agents, whether national or
            international, have played a central role in: (a)
            introducing the reforms to the executive of the national LAM
            agencies and in shepherding the policy reform bills through
            the Congress and the Senate; and (b) developing the
            Executive and Administrative Orders in support of the
            reforms and the systems, and technology and training
            programs for the improvement of LAM service delivery. It is
            also critical to identify executive champions in the
            national LAM agencies and in the Congress and the Senate. In
            parallel with the development of the policy agenda,
            committed political champions, preferably a Committee
            Chairperson in the Senate and Congress needs to be
            identified as well as other key officials and gatekeepers of
            the legislative process. Equally important is to obtain the
            support of strong champions at the local level committed to
            advancing property valuation reforms. Moreover, the
            systematic adoption of market-based SMV by all local
            governments, rather than just by those with a vocation
            toward reform, needs to be a requirement from the central
            government that is adequately enforced. This is particularly
            important given the perceived political cost attached to the
            increase in property assessments.

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Second Land Administration
            and Management Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the Second
            Land Administration and Management Project for Philippines
            are to increase land tenure security and improve land
            administration services through the implementation of
            institutional and legal reform, the realization of an
            accelerated land titling program, and the establishment of a
            fair and uniform property valuation system. The closing date
            of the project will be extended from December 31, 2012 to
            September 30, 2013. The purpose of this further extension to
            the loan closing date is to enable the government to secure
            the necessary approvals for the additional financing. This
            will be the third extension of the project.

display_title.display_title:
Philippines - Second Land
            Administration and Management Project : restructuring (Vol.
            2) : Data sheet

repnme.cdata!:
Philippines - Second Land Administration
            and Management Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Second Land
            Administration and Management Project for Philippines are to
            increase land tenure security and improve land
            administration services through the implementation of
            institutional and legal reform, the realization of an
            accelerated land titling program, and the establishment of a
            fair and uniform property valuation system. The extension is
            necessary to complete and/or undertake the remaining project
            activities. These include: a) development of policy
            guidelines on cost and fees for computerized verification
            and inter-agency data sharing; b) continuing support to
            property valuation activities; c) continuing support to
            professional regulatory board of real estate services; d)
            continuing support to formation of a professional valuers
            body; and e) continuing support for information and
            education on the valuation reform act bill in the 15th
            congress until enacted. A revised project implementation
            plan that covers up to the revised loan closing date of
            December 31, 2012 has been prepared by the project and found
            acceptable by the task team. This will be the second
            extension of the project.

display_title.display_title:
Philippines - Second Land
            Administration and Management Project : restructuring : Main report
